comments.commentBody:
"Bad Boys Bad Boys whatcha gonna do when they come for you" . Inner Circle's reggae theme for the television show "Cops" has been ringing in my ears since the beginning of the Trump campaign and ultimate presidency. Sad.

My beautiful green-eyed, pale, white skinned Ukrainian mother endured this constant slur as a child.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hunky
Hunky may refer to: A derogatory American slang term for immigrants of Ruthenian, Hungarian or Slovak descent, originating in the political status of the homeland of many such immigrants, the Austro-Hungarian Empire.

Richard Spencer (coiner of the word alt-right )in an interview November 17th. 2016 on NPR related that the acceptable Americans would be from the Germans, Slavs and Celts- how kind of him now to give the Slavs his imprimatur.

A young green-carded Moldovan immigrant acquaintance of mine ( is considering that his move to America was a mistake) is worried about Trump's new Gestapo agency VOICE (Victims of Immigration Crime Engagement). Even though he is very white, and not Muslim he was upset over immigrants with green cards being detained and deported in airports. "Are they gonna throw me out?!"

Of the acceptable "white people" the new scapegoats will be the intellectuals, protesters, those colluding with unacceptable groups like "Black Lives Matter" and so on. These people always need scapegoats.

This is not good.

Thank-you for this excellent article.

Precisely why all of us need to remain alert and unafraid to resist, protest and let our voices be heard. It can't be just up to the news agencies that Trump and his cronies are actively trying to discredit. They can report news. It is up to us to create meaningful and impressive news of resistance that they may accurately report.This article exposes the dirty little secrets that not all of us understood. Had this well founded article been in the press before the election, just perhaps a few more people would have taken the Trump presidency threat seriously . Maybe seriously enough to vote for Hillary rather than waste a vote and result in electing the "yuge" Darkness anyway.
Well done, Dan
I put Petra there as well!

Exellent informative article.

Wish someone would deeply research and write a Fran Brodie style (Jefferson and slavery and Sallie Hemings) "psycho-history" of Jefferson Beauregard Sessions, and also one on Bannon, Miller and DJT.

However, I suspect a portion of the impetus of Sessions' continuing white supremacist, anti-immigrant animus comes from his hurt at his earlier embarrasing failure to be confirmed by the Senate. Rather than admit his earlier racist acts and changing from how he must have been brought up in small-town Alabama - he has kept his racism alive as manifested in his anti-immigrant views. And found comfort with fellow compadres he meets along the way.
As an Alabamian who graduated - later - from Sessions' law school alma mater (U. A.) I can testfy to being told there there that we "were the elites." Things have changed a lot in Alabama - but not enough for some of those steeped in a racially permeated culture - to be able to grow.

It is said of Thomas Jefferson that he should not be judged by today's standards. Sessions has no such excuse, which is why I would love to know more of his psycho-history and upbringing and influences.

Or maybe it is best to keep one's sanity and not ponder too much what is in some folks' heads. Maybe I really don't want to know.
The relic of Sessions must go. Thank you for article.
You were asleep because CNN would talk about "the two candidates" as if they were on par and about their "issues" as if they can be compared.

It's a sad that you aren't aware of the fact that there is a serious problem with poverty in this country. There ARE people who don't have cars, adequate housing, food, or access to help. Instead of helping the poor (in your Christian nation), you call them demons.

Thank you for this excellent piece.

I never understood where Bannon fitted into the whole picture of the rallies and the election. Or where he came from. Or why he suddenly was in the Oval Office. Because I had no familiarity with Brietbart, or its mantra.

When Trump the salesman was primed to be the mouthpiece for the rhetoric of fear and dystopia, I had asked myself where did the nativism, xenophobia come from? ( The inauguration speech). Now I see the connection between Sessions life long racism and Steve Bannons white nationalism and the apprentice to hate, Miller. This is much more sinister than Trumps Russian connection, which is, I suspect financial, as it flies to the heart of and very core of what it means to be American, think the Statue of Liberty. The hateful way immigrants are being treated. Who's next?

The flighty, chatty, innocent looking Sessions is the enabler to Bannon
and the Golum to Trump. He has or had the ring, which needs to be taken from him.

Gorsuch must be challenged and stopped he will merely endorse and amplify the Bannon/Sessions/trump propaganda of hate and fear.
Thanks.

On a final note is the Trump/Russian connection being used as the "distractor" in this case?
The fear is part of the new regime. It stop you from thinking and planning what to do next. Sessions and Bannon planned this!

I'm old too. Doesn't mean you cannot fight back. Join the ACLU, ADL, SPLC, write, read and support newspapers, media. Your voice is essential. Fear will not take away the America we love, warts and all.
No they will spread manufacturer fear.

This is beautifully told. What is it about trains? I had a similar situation of assuming the worst about someone on a train who turned out, in truth, to be an angel. I don't have the space, but that man who I assumed was the lazy father of a struggling and exhausted women with three small children was actually a stranger who was helping her. Seeing his compassion (all other passengers were shooting her dirty looks) I began to help her also. Later that day he gave my 10 year old son a frank lecture about using birth control, and he also befriended another stranger, a young woman with no short-term memory because she had been shaken as an infant. It was quite a trip and I think he deeply affected both me and my son. And probably everyone else he comes in contact with.

I enjoyed reading this article although I found it abruptly ending; sort of anti-climatic.

I am from Pakistan and only lived there until the age of 7. I was fortunate enough to travel to the Northern Areas of Pakistan and can understand the nostalgia although don't have any memories of traveling by train.

I vividly recall staying at some hut in the Swat Valley with chickens roaming the area. Nostalgia indeed!

Thank you for publishing this story.

When my sister was about 4 years old she wandered from our house (on a quiet street) to a very busy street. A man asked her where she lived. All she knew was "New House". So he parked his car and and held her until my Mom (in a total panic) arrived frantically searching for her. You never know when you will find (or need) a guardian angel.

I'm glad you took the train.
A great piece of writing! Thank you.
Yes, a wonderful story. And so thoughtfully and beautifully told. Thank you for remembering so well.

Thanks for sharing...Reminds of this TED Talk by Adichie about the danger of single story - https://www.ted.com/talks/chimamanda_adichie_the_danger_of_a_single_stor... fear of instant judgment without truly knowing the intent of a person

I rode this train 30 years ago.  I could picture the stop where the mugging occurred.  I had chained my bag to the seats so I could sleep.  There were steam engines working the yards.  It was a trip back in time and enjoyable for the most part.  The hard seat rides in China were worse, far noisier and much dirtier.
lovely, has a touch of the style of Manto.

Sorry,  no. There is no redemption. The man helping the child was a good act, but twisting it to deny the woman's perception is exactly the sort of lie that abusers tell. He was doing so etching bad, staring aggressively at her. Do not deny her perception of her reality. He helped the child, and then sought to redeem his earlier action by lying about his earlier motive. See the lie for what it is.
How on earth do you know?

I do, too.  The driver takes dispatched calls from a company but also has his own business--on the meter.  I use him for airport and train station runs and for important medical appointments including a family member's day surgery that ran very late.  This guy picked us up in the very late evening.  His car is immaculate and, by the way, he is a legal resident from one of those countries included in the "Muslim ban."  Oops...

People are free to negotiate their own rides. Unfortunately for Uber, their business model is as a broker. That makes them susceptible to all of the relevant laws and regs in every jurisdiction in which they choose to operate.

Also, the idea that Uber is a simple coalition of ride sharing drivers is patently false.
Your fellow citizens voted for the law that ran uber/lyft out of town.

Ridesharing got busted in Dallas where it was established that there were "drivers" who were clearly felons that would have been easily verified if there had been a background check.

http://www.wfaa.com/news/no-rules-of-the-road/408093800

???!!! Uber is not bypassing "intransigent cities"!

It is ignoring their laws by barrelling in and just doing whatever they want, using technology and influence peddling and any other dirty trick available, to get what they want.

What kind of country would be have if every corporation turned into Uber? Things have already gone from bad to worse over the past 20 years as too many companies have turned into lobbying machines and labor and customer exploiters.

You really want to turn American life into an a competition between the big, well funded and lawless buccaneers vs the rest of us?

You want to lose while admiring the ones who ripped you off? Not me.
